review_title: Good quality feel. Brightest flashlight I've ever owned,but it gets HOT!!
reviews: Yes, this is a BRIGHT flashlight and it's well built. My only complaint is the design flaw of a side button that's so easy to accidentally be turned on. Today at work, while sitting in my car for my lunch break, I had the flashlight in its belt holster. At some point, I leaned against the light, and turned it on by accident. I only realized it once I felt a sharp pain at my waist. I took the flashlight out and it was absolutely too hot to touch. Had my shirt not been tucked in and had the "protection" of the fabric holster, I would have had serious burns. Imagine if that happened while driving. I couldn't believe how hot the entire metal body got from end to end. I barely got the light out of the holster without burning the hell out of my fingers. That being said, there should be better protection against accidental activation of the button. This could really be a problem if someone happened to fall asleep while wearing it, like I almost did. Other than that, it's a great light.

reviews:
I picked up this torch for my daughter. Where she works, she sometimes has to go out behind the store to a dumpster to toss boxes and there is no light.
This is mainly so that there will be light for her to see, but also since it is so extremely bright, hopefully God forbid if she ever did have to use it to blind an attacker, I have every confidence in the world the the brightness of this torch will thoroughly do the job.

Right away after receiving this light I could tell that it was quality from the make of the box and its heft for a small flashlight.
Everything was packaged expertly and in perfect condition. Once I tightened up the battery compartments the light began to work.
This light is super bright. Extremely easy to use. The interface is simple on or off and easy to get to other settings as well.
Only thing that I found a bit difficult was getting the lanyard string through that itty bitty tiny hole. I managed to do this with the aid of a paperclip.
The extra power connector port covers and o-rings are also much appreciated.

I truly like this torch and I will most likely be picking up one for my wife and myself very soon.
These sure make excellent stocking stuffers!

reviews:
I did a lot of research before choosing an EDC flashlight, and in the end chose this one due to its 1-lumen firefly/starlight mode, it's crazy high 2000+ lumen turbo (which is real according to the lumen measures I have at home), and how long it can last at 1000+ lumens.

The only negative reviews I read when doing research mentioned size, heat, and a hard-to-find-by-touch button. I have to say the size is perfect for me; not at all difficult as a pocket EDC in a pair of (men's) jeans or slacks. The heat "problem" is real, though it's simple physics and actually not at all a problem for me to continue carrying the flashlight "normally" (ie not putting your hand on the part of the light where the LED is or higher). It's quite warm, but not painful to hold at all. This is the best light I've ever bought for this purpose. The only thing I'd change about it if I could would be to give it a tail switch. I can pull a light out and turn it on much faster with a tail switch, and I like carrying lights in that position. However I'll say that the solution to finding the nearly-flush button is just to line up your pocket clip with the button so you can follow the line in the dark.

Glad I bought this!

reviews:
The performance of the TC15 is of course just amazing both on paper and in person. The thing I really love about this and a few of my other Thrunites is the beam pattern. It is just the perfect balance of hotspot and flood. One of my concerns with a competitor was that the beam did not reach out quite enough in a dark hallway or outside. Some other "tactical" lights have too focused a hotspot and not enough flood. The TC15 is just right.

The only thing keeping me from giving the TC15 full marks is that the lens came from the factory with a series of tiny scratches seemingly on the inside. Not a huge deal but not what I would expect for the money.

I have not had it long enough to comment on battery life, but seems just fine.

review_title: ThruNite TC15 2300 High Lumens: Cool White
reviews: I have owned a ThruNite TH20 Cool White 520 Lumen headlamp for several years, which my daughter bought me. I use it at least 3-5 nights per week while working outside on a small farm. I use a Kentli rechargeable Li Ion AA battery in it most of the time, which gets me a solid 90-120 minutes run time at about a 280 lumens setting, plenty of light to work with. I live in a high rainfall area and this item has gotten wet many times. Bottom line: it is a fantastically durable product with excellent lighting, and is incredibly lightweight. I was looking for a supplemental light to add to my night lighting arsenal (feral swine spot-lite) and I wanted something rechargeable, lightweight, with a LOT of throw, and small/compact enough to easily put in my jeans pocket. I purchased the TC15 to fill this need. The TC15 is INSANELY bright for it's size and even at the 1050 lumens (90 min) setting lights up areas 200-300 feet away like it's daylight! I have only had it about 2 weeks, but so far the specs are as claimed. I am extremely pleased and only hope it stands the test of time and usefulness that the TH20 has.

reviews:
User Interface - I really like the user interface. You click it once to turn it on and once to turn it off. You hold it to change from low-medium-high. It is very intuitive and allows you to have the perfect brightness level for any situation. The firefly mode is excellent. It's great for doing sensitive tasks, such as checking fish in a fish tank or maybe inspecting someone's eye without straining it with a brighter light. The turbo mode is great, but the light gets very hot. I like that I have the option if I really need it, but I will probably use the high setting 90% of the time outside. The build is solid, and I feel like this light will last a long time.

My only complaint is that it is difficult to find the power button by feel if you grab the light in the dark. Once it's on the power button lights up indicating the battery level, but it's flat against the body and difficult to find without that light. I'm thinking I'm going to attach a tiny piece of rubber to the power button so that it's easier to grab in the night. I think that if the power button were moved to the back of the light that would fix this issue, but overall it's a great light.

reviews: I’ve had this flashlight (NW version) for about 2 months now and it hasn’t let me down. I really enjoy the simple UI, the USB charging port (though I wish it was type-C), and brightness levels that were chosen. I usually keep the flashlight at medium brightness and it delivers enough light for all of my day to day tasks. The battery that ships with the flashlight is great as well. I’ve tried various other 18650’s in this light and they all work, however, make sure that you’re using a battery with a high enough discharge rate as the emitter draws quite a bit at high and turbo. Build quality is top notch. I’ve dropped it a few times onto concrete and haven’t had any issues, rattles, nothing. The reflector delivers a nice hotspot with useable flood. Things I think could be improved on would be the aforementioned small inconvenience of it not having a USB Type-C port and the button. It works well, clicks nicely and has a power indicator light built into it, however, I’ve found myself on multiple occasions fumbling around with the flashlight searching for the button with my thumb. Not a deal breaker or that big of a deal to me but, it might be to some looking for a new EDC light. Overall amazing product. I have many other flashlights on all ends of the spectrum and find myself walking out of the house with this flashlight more often than not.

review_title: Be sure to tighten the end cap
reviews:
When I received this product I tried to turn it on out of the box and found it wouldn't light.
Naturally I presumed the battery must be out or there was something blocking the contacts of the battery.
I opened the flashlight at the middle and didn't see any problems.
After a quick check I found the light to be operable only while being charged.
I thought at this point that I had a faulty battery, but continued fiddling around with the flashlight and finally I noticed there was a removable end cap, which I then tightened.
This fixed the issue I thought I was having and this flashlight exceeds expectations!
The turbo light is REALLY bright and you can feel the heat just from the beam.
Also feels really sturdy and it comes with replacement rubber seals for the charge port.
Overall feels like a great product, I was not able to evaluate the night vision at this time.

reviews:

This is a very reliable, well built EDC and camping flashlight, I did my research and watched a ton of reviews and I am so satisfied I finally got me one of these.
Interface becomes easy once you get used to it, battery life is amazing, I have carried it for 20 days with only 1 charge and it still going (it depends on your personal use), I carry it with the sheath it came with and that is all I need for my work and personal flashlight use.

Highly recommended for work and camping trips.

review_title: Really bright but gets hot on high setting
reviews:
I like the torch so far but am concerned about how hot it feels to the touch after just a few minutes of use on the brightest setting. My worry is that there is damage possibly occurring to the battery with it becoming so hot—and thus a potential safety issue—and possible impact to the life of both the battery and LEDs as well.

I have experienced this before with a different branded torch.

My suggestion would be to consider using a material for the housing other than metal that would either not be as heat-conductive, or that could dissipate the heat more quickly.

reviews:
I am a driver for railroad crews, and I use this flashlight every night.
I use it for vehicle inspection, terrain examination for access to trains, and walking to the van lot at night.
The multiple brightness levels are perfect for my needs.
The only complaint is that I had trouble at first getting it to work.
There was no plastic disc in the head that other reviewers described, but it still would not turn on, and blinked purple on charge. After tightening the head and tail cap, it worked perfectly.
The charge port is very handy: I can recharge it off the van USB port.
